intro: Platystele orchestris, commonly known as the orchid mycorrhizal plant, is a rare and unique member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. This plant is notable for its specialized relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, which play a crucial role in its nutrient uptake. Its roots are highly modified to form symbiotic associations with specific fungal species, enabling it to absorb nutrients from the nutrient-poor soil. Due to its delicate nature and limited distribution, Platystele orchestris is considered an endangered species.
